title: Metrojet Flight 9268
summary: Metrojet Flight 9268 was an international chartered passenger flight,[1] operated by Russian airline Kogalymavia (branded as Metrojet). On 31 October 2015, at 06:13 local time EST (04:13 UTC),[2] an Airbus A321-231 operating the flight was destroyed by a bomb above the northern Sinai Peninsula following its departure from Sharm El Sheikh International Airport, Egypt en route to Pulkovo Airport, Saint Petersburg, Russia.[3][4][5] All 224 passengers and crew on board were killed.[6][7] The cause of the crash was most likely an onboard explosive device[8][9][10] as concluded by Russian investigators.[11]
